Examples

Draw a pixel

from casioplot import *

red = (255, 0, 0)
set_pixel(10, 10, red)
show_screen()  # Don't forget to show the screen to see the result.

Result:

Draw a rectangle

from casioplot import *


def rectangle(start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y, color):
    x = abs(end_x - start_x)
    y = abs(end_y - start_y)
    for i in range(x + 1):
        for j in range(y + 1):
            set_pixel(i + start_x, j + start_y, color)


red = (255, 0, 0)
rectangle(10, 10, 200, 100, red)
show_screen()  # Don't forget to show the screen to see the result.

Result:

Get a pixel value

from casioplot import *


def rectangle(start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y, color):
    x = abs(end_x - start_x)
    y = abs(end_y - start_y)
    for i in range(x + 1):
        for j in range(y + 1):
            set_pixel(i + start_x, j + start_y, color)


red = (255, 0, 0)
rectangle(10, 10, 200, 100, red)

match get_pixel(20, 20):
    case r, g, b:
        print('Red:  ', r)
        print('Green:', g)
        print('Blue: ', b)
    case None:
        print('Out of the screen.')

Result:

Red:   255
Green: 0
Blue:  0

Note that you don’t need to show the screen to get the color of a pixel.
